data.title: Dispatch Coordinator 2024
data.description:
About us: Nova Lines is a flatbed trucking company with an operations center located in Chisinau, Moldova. Established in Chicago, IL in 2014, we were among the pioneers who brought US trucking job opportunities to the Moldovan market. We load and manage over 300 trucks. Nova Lines keeps growing, that's why we are looking for new employees to join our team.

What we offer:



  • Salary up to $3000 per month;

  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 3PM - 12AM;

  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations;

  • Performance bonuses, loyalty bonus;

  • Paid taxi back home;

  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district.


Your responsibilities:


  • Perform daily phone calls with brokers and drivers;

  • Search for loads on US truckload websites;

  • Negotiate competitive rates with brokers based on the current market;

  • Plan and schedule driver's routes;

  • Use various computer systems and programs (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Google drive, etc) to keep track of your drivers and their loads.


Requirements from you:



  • Advanced English level (minimum B2), both verbal and written;

  • PC skills proficiency (Microsoft Office, G Suite);

  • Ability to work on multiple tasks at once; 

  • Industry experience is a plus, but not required (we provide paid training for beginners);

  • The position is full-time and requires office presence. We are glad to welcome everyone who wants to grow with us!


Please submit your CV in English. We appreciate your submission, if your CV matches the requirements we will be sure to reach out with a call.

data.title: Accounting Coordinator 2024
data.description:
What we offer:



  • Salary starting with $700 a month; 


  • Official & legal employment;


  • Full vacation days schedule;


  • Outstanding work culture - weekly football games, video game championships and minimum 2 team-buildings per year;


  • Young and friendly team;


  • Paid taxi back home;


  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district.





Your responsibilities:



  • Process bills and invoices;


  • Communicate via email/phone with internal and external customers;


  • Verify the accuracy of documents;


  • Use basic systems and programs (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Google Drive, etc.).





Requirements from you:



  • Intermediate English level (minimum B1), both verbal and written;


  • Accounting experience in the US trucking industry is a plus, but not required (we provide training for beginners).


  • PC skills proficiency (Microsoft Office, Google Applications);


  • Strong attention to detail.





Contacts:


Please submit your CV in English, if your CV matches the requirements, we will be sure to reach out with a call.           For additional information contact our HR department: 022 858 865, 060 144 044 (12PM - 9PM)

data.title: After Hours Coordinator 2024
data.description:
Nova Lines is seeking an After-hours Coordinator to ensure that the drivers and clients receive exceptional service, even outside our regular business hours. The After Hours Coordinator will be responsible for monitoring our dispatch system, communicating with drivers, and ensuring that our client's freight is delivered on time and in good condition.

What we offer:


  • Salary up to $1400;

  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations;

  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 12 AM - 7 AM;

  • Paid taxi back home;

  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district;



Key responsibilities:



  • Monitor the dispatch system and respond promptly to incoming driver requests and updates;


  • Coordinate with clients to ensure that their freight is picked up and delivered on time and in good condition;


  • Develop expertise in safety and maintenance regulations;


  • Troubleshoot and resolve any issues that may arise during transportation;


  • Document all communication and actions were taken during the shift;


  • Maintain a high level of communication and professionalism with drivers and clients.




Requirements from you:



  • Advanced English level (minimum B2), both verbal and written;


  • Previous experience in the US trucking industry represents an advantage;


  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written;


  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail;


  • Computer proficiency;


  • Ability to work night shifts;

data.title: Cargo Securement Compliance
data.description:
As a Cargo Securement Compliance Coordinator, you will be responsible for supporting and advising Nova Lines’ drivers on how to safely load, secure, and transport different types of cargo. You will be identifying the risks and issues on different flatbed commodities, in order to avoid DOT violations, claims- or load shifts. 


Your responsibilities:


  • Checking and analyzing cargo securement pictures based on The Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA) regulations; 


  • Supporting and advising drivers and dispatchers via phone/internal chats on cargo securement issues;


  • Reporting about all securement issues to the Safety team; 


  • Updating internal CRM with information about cases that happened with the drivers;


  • Training new employees. 



Requirements:


  • Industry experience is a plus, but not required (we provide training for beginners);


  • Advanced English level (minimum B2), both verbal and written;


  • PC skills proficiency (Microsoft Office, G Suite);


  • Ability to grasp new concepts quickly;


  • Strong attention to detail.



What we offer:


  • Salary from $1000;


  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations;


  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 3 PM – 12AM;


  • Paid taxi back home;


  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district.

data.title: Claims Specialist 2024
data.description:
As a Claims Specialist, your main responsibility will be to investigate, gather, and report about truck related claims. Position requires great customer service skills and attention to detail, since you will have to evaluate each case on liability and damages. 



What we offer:



  • Salary up to $1300 a month;


  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations;


  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 3 PM - 12 AM;


  • Paid taxi back home;


  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district.





Your responsibilities:



  • Gather and organize necessary documentation;


  • Investigate claims to determine liability;


  • Communicate via phone and email with insurance providers and other parties involved;


  • Negotiate settlements and ensure compliance;


  • Maintain accurate records of claims activities.





Requirements from you:



  • Advanced English level (minimum B2), both verbal and written;


  • PC skills proficiency;


  • Ability to maintain organized and precise records and storage of evidence;


  • Experience in negotiation and mediation;


  • Ability to effectively manage multiple accounts;

data.title: Data Entry Specialist 2023
data.description:
We are looking for a Data Entry Specialist to join our Safety Department. In this role, you will be responsible for comparing and migrating data between the spreadsheets. The position is full-time and requires office presence. 


Your responsibilities:


  • Input and update data into our spreadsheets;


  • Verify accuracy of entered data to ensure completeness and correctness;


  • Identify errors and take appropriate corrective action;


  • Perform other duties as assigned.



Requirements from you:


  • Intermediate level of English (written and oral); 


  • Proven experience in data entry or a similar role is preferred;


  • Proficiency in using Microsoft suite of tools;


  • Strong typing skills with good accuracy;


  • Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with others;




What we offer:



  • Salary starting with $700 a month; 


  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 3 PM - 12 AM;


  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations; 


  • Paid taxi back home;


  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district.

data.title: DQ Files 2023
data.description:
We are looking for a candidate with data entry documentation background to manage our US drivers’ qualification files. You will be mostly working individually, ensuring the existing and new Nova Lines drivers’ records and documents meet the safety, health, and qualifications necessary to operate a Commercial Motor Vehicle (CMV).


Your responsibilities:


  • Review and maintain drivers’ qualification files, making sure they are compliant and up to date;


  • Ensure accuracy in the documentation provided by the drivers; 


  • Communicate with a fleet of US drivers regarding the renewal of their documents;


  • Collaborate with Nova Lines’ recruiting department in the US on driver’s onboarding.



Requirements from you:


  • Experience working with documentation and introducing data in the system;


  • Good communication and written English skills (minimum B1);


  • Ability to communicate in writing to convey messages and information;


  • Ability to learn new tools quickly;


  • Strong attention to detail.



What we offer:


  • Salary from $800;


  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations;


  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 3PM – 12AM;


  • Paid taxi back home;


  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district.

data.title: Driver Log Auditor
data.description:
Nova Lines is a Moldo-American company with headquarters in Illinois and Operations Center in Chisinau. Having over 300 drivers all over the US, we want to make sure they operate safely and their driving hours are used in the most efficient and accurate way.
We are seeking a candidate who will be responsible for analyzing driver’s Hours of Service (HOS) records. If you like working with data, have strong attention to detail and a good level of English, we encourage you to apply!
 
What we Offer:


  • Salary up to $800;

  • Additional pay of $50 for work during the US federal holidays;

  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations;

  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 9AM - 6PM;

  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district;


Your Responsibilities: 


  • Analyze driver’s Hours of Service (HOS) records and collect data;

  • Work with several platforms to gather and store data; 

  • Maintain accurate records of the driving activities; 

  • Inform relevant parties regarding the shortcomings encountered.


Job Requirements:


  • Experience in logistics and knowledge of the FMCSA safety regulations would be an advantage;

  • Good English level (minimum B1), both verbal and written;

  • Previous experience in data entry;

  • PC skills proficiency;

  • Detail-oriented, self-motivated, and the ability to work independently are essential competencies.


Please submit your CV in English. We appreciate your submission, if your CV matches the requirements we will be sure to reach out with a call.

data.title: Executive Assistant
data.description:
Our organization is looking to employ an experienced Executive Assistant who will coordinate and manage scheduling,  prepare and organize important strategic materials and plans, and be a right-hand person to the principal. If you see yourself contributing and developing within an international company with over 100 employees, can bring a can-do attitude to the team, the Executive Assistant position at Nova Lines might be just what you were looking for. 


What we offer:


  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations;


  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 3 PM - 12AM;


  • Paid taxi back home;


  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district.



Your responsibilities:


  • Act as the point of contact between the executive, employees, clients and other external partners;


  • Schedule and attend meetings along with the executive, taking notes and recording minutes;


  • Assist with creation/modification of presentations, spreadsheets, and other various documents;


  • Screen and prioritize incoming communications, including emails, phone calls, and mail;


  • Conduct research and gather information as needed for projects and reports;


  • Perform general administrative tasks, such as filing, data entry, and document management;


  • Perform additional duties as assigned.



Requirements from you:


  • Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or in a similar administrative role;


  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Romanian;


  • PS skills proficiency (Microsoft Office Suite, Zoom, etc.) and willingness to learn new applications as needed;


  • Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively;


  • Ability to preserve discretion and confidentiality.

data.title: Office Manager
data.description:
Compania Nova Lines cu sediul central în Chicago, IL și cu Centru de Operațiuni în Chișinău este în căutarea unui Office Manager cu experiență. Avem nevoie de o persoană care o să ne ajute să asigurăm desfășurarea eficientă a proceselor în oficiul local cu peste 100 de angajați. Dacă ești o persoană dinamică cu aptitudini descrise mai jos te invităm să aplici!


Noi îți oferim:


  • Salariu începând cu $700 pe lună;


  • Program de muncă Luni până Vineri, 10:00 - 19:00;


  • Angajare oficială, pachet social complet;


  • Birou modern în sectorul Botanica.



Responsabilităţi:


  • Gestionarea și supravegherea operațiunile zilnice de birou, inclusiv întreținerea consumabilelor, echipamentelor și facilităților de birou;


  • Participarea la pregatirea bugetelor pentru cheltuielile de oficiu și evidența lor; 


  • Asistarea la pregătirea și organizarea documentelor, rapoartelor; 


  • Administrarea dosarelor de personal ale angajaților și colaboratorilor;


  • Gestionarea corespondenței interne și externe (primita) a biroului; 


  • Alte sarcini administrative atribuite după necesitate.



Cerințe:


  • Experiență minimă de 2 ani ca Office Manager sau într-un rol administrativ similar;


  • Atenție deosebită la detalii și abilități de rezolvare a problemelor;


  • Competențe în Microsoft Office la nivel mediu-avansat și alte software-uri relevante;


  • Cunoașterea sistemelor și procedurilor de management al biroului;


  • Cunoașterea limbii engleze la nivel începător.

data.title: Recruitment Specialist
data.description:
As a Recruiter/Interviewer in logistics, you will be responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top talent to support the staffing needs of our organization. You will work closely with hiring managers and department heads to understand their staffing requirements and develop effective recruitment strategies. This role requires the ability to identify candidates with the right skills and qualifications according to company needs and culture.



Is this you?



  • 2 years of proven work experience as a Recruiter/Interviewer;


  • Solid ability to conduct different types of interviews (structured, competency-based, etc;)


  • Hands-on experience with various selection processes;


  • Familiarity with HR databases, Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS);


  • Proficient English level;

  • Strong interpersonal skills, high learning agility, analytical and decision-making skills;


  • Entrepreneurial qualities necessary for managing risk and leading change;


  • Curiosity and passion for learning and continuous improvement.





Key Responsibilities:



  • Utilize various recruitment methods such as job boards, social media, networking, and industry events to identify potential candidates;


  • Build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings;


  • Review resumes and applications to assess candidates' qualifications and match them with job requirements;


  • Conduct interviews, both in-person and via video conferencing, to evaluate candidates' skills, experience, and cultural fit;


  • Administer skills assessments and tests as needed to evaluate candidates' technical abilities;


  • Work closely with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and priorities;


  • Provide guidance and recommendations to hiring managers on candidate selection;


  • Extend job offers to selected candidates and negotiate compensation packages as necessary;


  • Keep detailed records of candidate interactions and feedback;


  • Update and maintain the candidate database;


  • Stay updated on industry trends and salary benchmarks to provide valuable insights;


  • Project tasks such as: Adapting new Recruitment Soft to the company's needs, career fairs, and relevant events.





What we offer:



  • Competitive salary package;


  • Schedule from Monday till Friday, 11 AM- 8 PM or 12 PM - 9 PM;


  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations and medical leave;


  • Outstanding work culture - minimum 2 team buildings per year;


  • Young and friendly team;


  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district.

data.title: Safety Coordinator 2023
data.description:
Your role as a Safety Coordinator will involve monitoring and managing drivers’ Hours of Service to promote safe and efficient operations. To ensure adherence to the FMCSA regulations, you will be communicating to our American drivers daily both over the phone and in writing. The position is full-time and requires office presence.


What we offer: 


  • Salary from up to $1300 a month;


  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations;


  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 3 PM - 12 AM;


  • Paid taxi back home;


  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district.



Your responsibilities:



  • Audit driver logs and provide reports of findings for management review; 


  • Assist with compliance with the driver’s Hours of Service regulations, including reviewing of logs, and log corrections;


  • Engage with drivers through phone and written communication to provide guidance on HOS compliance, address concerns, and provide necessary support regarding ELD and HOS;


  • Review and verification of emails, routine documentation review and data entry;


  • Assist in monitoring and enforcing compliance with the drug and alcohol policy;



Requirements from you:



  • Previous experience in the same position would be an advantage; 


  • Advanced English level (minimum B2), both verbal and written;


  • PC skills proficiency (you will work with multiple programs);


  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize the tasks;


  • Great interpersonal skills, customer relations, and the ability to work independently are essential competencies.

data.title: Experienced Dispatch Coordinator 2024
data.description:
Nova Lines is a flatbed trucking company with an operations center located in Chisinau, Moldova. Established in Chicago, IL in 2014, we were among the pioneers who brought US trucking job opportunities to the Moldovan market. We load and manage over 300 trucks. Nova Lines keeps growing, that's why we are looking for new employees to join our team.


What we offer:


  • Salary up to $3500 a month;

  • % from the gross;

  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 3 PM - 12AM;

  • Performance bonuses, loyalty bonus;

  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations;

  • Outstanding work culture - weekly football games, video game championships, and minimum 2 team-buildings per year;

  • Young and friendly team;

  • Paid taxi back home;

  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district;



You responsibilities:


  • Perform daily phone calls with brokers and drivers;

  • Search for loads on US truckload websites;

  • Negotiate competitive rates with brokers based on the current market;

  • Plan and schedule driver's routes;

  • Use basic computer systems and programs (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Google Drive, etc) to keep track of your drivers and their loads.



Requirements from you:


  • Advanced English level (minimum B2), both verbal and written;

  • Minimum of 9 months experience as a dispatcher on the US market (preferably dispatching flatbeds);

  • PC skills proficiency (Microsoft Office, Google Applications);

  • The position is full-time and requires office presence. We are glad to welcome everyone who wants to grow with us!

data.title: Maintenance Coordinator 2023
data.description:
The Maintenance Department at Nova Lines plays a crucial role in ensuring the integrity and safety of our fleet through meticulous upkeep and repairs. 


From routine inspections to emergency repairs, our skilled maintenance team works tirelessly to maintain our vehicles in top condition, minimizing downtime and maximizing efficiency.




Key responsibilities:



  • Answer and respond to all maintenance requests from truck drivers;


  • Coordinate with vendors and mechanics to ensure timely repair of all trucks;


  • Schedule regular maintenance and inspections to ensure all trucks are in good working condition;


  • Keep accurate records of all maintenance and repair work performed on the truck;


  • Ensure compliance with all safety and environmental regulations related to truck maintenance and repairs;


  • Provide regular updates to the Maintenance Manager regarding maintenance issues and resolutions;





Requirements:



  • Advanced English level (minimum B2), both verbal and written;


  • Experience in truck maintenance or similar roles will be considered an advantage;


  • Knowledge of truck/ car maintenance and repair processes;


  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.;


  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously;


  • Computer proficiency;


  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.




What we offer:



  • Salary up to $1300;


  • Performance bonuses, loyalty bonuses;?


  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations;


  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 3 PM - 12 AM;


  • Paid taxi back home;


  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district;




Contacts:
Please submit your CV in English, if your CV matches the requirements, we will be sure to reach out with a call.           
For additional information contact our HR department: 022 858 865, 060 144 044 (12PM - 9PM)

What we offer:

  • Schedule from Monday to Friday, 12 AM - 7 AM;

Key responsibilities:


  • Monitor the dispatch system and respond promptly to incoming driver requests and updates;

  • Coordinate with clients to ensure that their freight is picked up and delivered on time and in good condition;

data.title: People Development Manager
data.description:
The People Development Manager is responsible for improving the productivity of the organization's employees. This position assesses company-wide developmental needs to drive training initiatives and identifies and arranges suitable training solutions for employees. This position actively searches, creatively designs, and implements effective methods to educate, enhance performance, and recognize performance.


Your responsibilities:



  • Develops training and development programs and objectives;


  • Conducts annual training and development needs assessment;


  • Administers spending against the departmental budget and negotiates contracts;


  • Obtains and /or develops effective training materials utilizing a variety of media;


  • Train and coach managers, supervisors, and others involved in employment and training events;


  • Develops and maintains organizational communications to ensure employee development efforts;


  • Plans, organizes, facilitates, and orders supplies for employee development so that employees know training and development events and resources;


  • Conduct follow-up studies of all completed training to evaluate and measure results;


  • Modifies programs as needed.


  • Exemplifies the desired culture and philosophies of the organization.


  • Works effectively as a team member with other management and HR staff members.



What we expect:

  • Proven experience of minimum 3 years as PDM, HR, Trainer, or other relevant fields. 


  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.


  • English proficient; 


  • Strong presentation skills.


  • Adept with a variety of multimedia training platforms and methods.


  • Ability to evaluate and research training options and alternatives.


  • Ability to design and implement effective training and development.




What we offer:

  • Schedule from Monday till Friday, 12 PM - 9 PM for probation period and flexible schedule from Monday till Friday after that;


  • Official employment, full social package, paid vacations, and 10 days medical leave covered by company;


  • Outstanding work culture -video game championships, and minimum 2 team-buildings per year with all company and with the team;


  • Modern, spacious office in Botanica district.

  • Negotiate competitive rates with brokers based on the current market;

  • Plan and schedule driver's routes;

  • Use various computer systems and programs (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Google drive, etc) to keep track of your drivers and their loads.


Requirements from you:


  • Advanced English level (minimum B2), both verbal and written;

  • PC skills proficiency (Microsoft Office, G Suite);

  • Ability to work on multiple tasks at once; 

  • Industry experience is a plus, but not required (we provide paid training for beginners);

  • The position is full-time and requires office presence. We are glad to welcome everyone who wants to grow with us!

Please submit your CV in English. We appreciate your submission, if your resume matches the requirements we will be sure to reach out with a call. 


For additional information contact our HR department: 022 858 869, 060 144 004 (12PM - 9PM).
